task_summary: Drive down the hallway and reach the visible goal region at the corridor end.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile robot navigates an indoor hallway toward a distant, bright rectangular goal area visible at the end of the corridor. The camera shows progressively closer views of the same end-wall target, suggesting straightforward, straight-line navigation with minor alignment near arrival. The behavior emphasizes checking whether the robot is already at the goal, attempting navigation with bounded time and retries, then performing a short alignment to settle precisely at the destination. No manipulation is required; perception is implicit in goal checks and alignment tolerance.
preconditions: Robot is localized sufficiently to use a named goal 'goal'.
Corridor is traversable without closed barriers.
stepwise_plan: Check if already at the goal.
If not, attempt to navigate to the named location 'goal' with a time-bounded trial and limited retries.
On arrival, perform a brief alignment with tight tolerance.
Verify final pose at the goal.
success_criteria: Robot stops within the goal region.
No timeouts or collisions during the approach.
failure_and_recovery: If a navigation attempt times out, retry up to three times.
If alignment exceeds tolerance, alignment action can be re-invoked by higher-level retry if needed.
If the goal becomes occluded, future attempts rely on localization to continue.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the final IsAt('goal') condition returns success.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if robot pose is within the goal region.
Navigate using a named waypoint to the goal with time limit.
Final short alignment to settle within tolerance at the goal.
Final verification that the robot is at the goal.

failure_modes: Navigation times out before reaching the goal.
Localization drift causes missed goal verification.
recovery_strategy: Retry navigation up to three attempts with bounded timeout.
Rely on repeated localization updates between attempts.
If blocked, subsequent attempt may re-plan around transient obstacle.
Repeat short alignment until verification succeeds via higher-level loop if available.
assumptions: The bright rectangle at corridor end represents the 'goal' region.
No explicit obstacle avoidance nodes are needed because the path appears clear.
The instruction provides a named goal accessible to NavigateToNamed; frames do not contradict this.

expected_success_criteria: Goal verification condition succeeds after navigation and alignment.
Cumulative runtime within reasonable limits given timeouts and retries.
